item.title: TIP: Automating Website Backups - Part IIb (Reducing Backup Size Contd.)
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: Last time, I had told you about how to reduce the backup size. Well, this is a short note further developing on the approaches discussed there. Basically, telling tar to backup only those files which have changed. For this, Linux has a command “find” which I am very fond of. You can give it a option “-newer” followed by a f”filename” and it will return the names of the files that are newer than filename.
